intro: Eriocaulon longicuspe, commonly known as the long-beaked spikerush, is a member of the Cyperaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and swamps, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of small, spike-like flower heads. Eriocaulon longicuspe plays a vital role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
